text: The 1952 New York Giants season was the franchise's 70th season. The team finished in second place in the National League with a 92-62 record, 4½ games behind the Brooklyn Dodgers. ==Offseason== * December 11, 1951: Eddie Stanky was traded by the Giants to the St. Louis Cardinals for Chuck Diering and Max Lanier.Eddie Stanky at Baseball Reference ==Regular season== ===Season standings=== === Record vs. opponents === ===Opening Day lineup=== ===Notable transactions=== * May 17, 1952: Bill Howerton was selected off waivers by the Giants from the Pittsburgh Pirates.Bill Howerton at Baseball Reference ===Roster=== {| class="toccolours" style="font-size: 95%;" |- !
